intro: Erythrina indica var. alba, commonly known as the white flame tree, is a deciduous legume native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its striking white to pale pink flowers that bloom in dense, branched clusters. The plant has trifoliate leaves composed of three oval-shaped leaflets. Its pods are elongated and contain several seeds, and the tree can grow up to 10 meters tall. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to tropical and subtropical climates.
